creditline: Gift of David Tausig Frank and Kazukuni Sugiyama
description: paper carton is wrapped in brown paper; wooden box with inscriptions inside; fabric is light green/grey; image of tree branches in black ink with inscription in LL corner
inscription:
梅花暁然白　雲上明月閑　春色満千里　一稜天地間　暗香入流水　緑影動空山　咨嘸相見高々 {?} (Plum blossoms mirror the white clouds of daybreak / The bright moon hangs silent in the spring sky / All corners of the world are filled with its light / Fragrance flows into the darkest places / The mountain greenery stands reflected in the clear waters / All I can do is to gaze.)
朏知香々則　花帥古不提　舌是吾家画　訣豈漫池　有哉不可〇 {?} (The moon knows: this fragrance is flower-borne a truth passed down from ancient times. I have brushed these poems apart, yet they are more beautiful to me than even the lovely pond beside my house.)
markings: URC red seal: [unread #5]; poem UR red seal: 〇〇 [unread #2]; LL red seals: 福田世耕 {Fukuda Seikō} [Fukuda Seikō #1], 静處 {seisho} [seisho #1]; LLC: [unread #8], [unread #9]
signed: LRC: 丙子春日於忘谷寓居古道人画并題 {hinoe-ne shunjitsu oite bōkoku gūkyo Kodōjin ga heidai}; LLC: 碧翁題 {Hekiō dai}
title: Old Plum
